title: Tamariani
text:
Tamariani () — is a rural locality (<a href="aul">aul</a>) in <a href="Dzheyrakhsky%20District">Dzheyrakhsky District</a> of the <a href="Republic%20of%20Ingushetia">Republic of Ingushetia</a>, <a href="Russia">Russia</a>. Tamariani is one of the 6 rural localities concluding <a href="Dzheyrakh%20rural%20settlement">Dzheyrakh rural settlement</a>. Tamariani has only one street named "Vodnaya", which means "aquatic" in <a href="Russian%20language">Russian</a>, referring to its geographical positioning on the right embankment of the Terek river.
History.
The village was established by <a href="Georgians">Georgian</a> settlers after the deportation of the whole Chechen and Ingush population to the Central Asia and consequential abolishment of the <a href="Chechen-Ingush%20ASSR">Chechen-Ingush ASSR</a>. After the Ingush population were allowed to return from the deportation, the Georgian inhabitants returned to Georgia. 
The name "Tamariani" translates from <a href="Georgian%20language">Georgian</a> "[the place] where Tamara was". A settlement with the same name exists in <a href="Georgia%20%28country%29">Georgia</a>.
